channel.title: JTF News Daily Digest
channel.itunes:author: JTF News
channel.description: Verified facts without opinion. Daily news digest following the JTF methodology: two unrelated sources, no adjectives, just facts. What happened, where, when, and how many. Nothing more.

item.title: JTF News - February 22, 2026
item.content:encoded:
5 verified facts for February 22, 2026.
- Russia and Ukraine reported overnight strikes on energy infrastructure. - U.S. Secret Service personnel shot and killed a man attempting to enter Mar-a-Lago. - The U.S. men's hockey team defeated Canada in overtime to win an Olympic gold medal. - The Mexican army killed drug lord Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as 'El Mencho'. - Olympic cauldrons were extinguished in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, signaling the end of the 2026 Winter Olympics.
JTF News: Two sources. No adjectives. Just facts.

item.title: JTF News - February 23, 2026
item.content:encoded:
13 verified facts for February 23, 2026.
- An armed man was killed after entering a secure perimeter of President Trump's residence, according to the Secret Service. - Mexican army reports death of drug trafficking organization leader Ismael Oseguera Cervantes. - Olympic cauldrons were extinguished in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, marking the conclusion of the 2026 Winter Olympics. - President Trump imposes a temporary import duty. - North Korea's ruling party reelected Kim Jong Un as general secretary. - The United States and Iran are scheduled to hold nuclear talks in Geneva on Thursday. - New York implemented a citywide travel ban as a major blizzard affected the eastern United States. - Robert Mugabe's son has been charged with attempted murder in South Africa. - British police arrested Peter Mandelson, a former ambassador to the United States, in connection with an investigation into connections to Jeffrey Epstein. - The International Criminal Court opens hearings into former President Rodrigo Duterte. - The Mexican army killed cartel leader Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as 'El Mencho.' - A son of Rob Reiner pleaded not guilty to charges related to the deaths of his parents. - The State Department ordered nonessential U.S. diplomats to leave Lebanon.
JTF News: Two sources. No adjectives. Just facts.

item.title: JTF News - February 24, 2026
item.content:encoded:
12 verified facts for February 24, 2026.
- A winter storm is affecting travel across the northeastern U.S. - The U.S. military conducted a strike on a suspected drug boat in the Caribbean, resulting in 3 deaths. - President Trump will deliver a State of the Union speech. - President Volodymyr Zelensky addressed the European Parliament as Ukraine marked four years since the Russian invasion began. - Mexico deployed thousands of soldiers in response to violence following the death of a drug lord. - Russell Brand pleaded not guilty to additional rape and sexual assault charges. - Nancy Guthrie's family offers $1 million reward for information regarding missing mother. - The United States partially evacuated its embassy in Beirut. - Prime Minister of Senegal proposes doubling jail terms for same-sex acts. - President Emmanuel Macron of France accepted the resignation of the Louvre director following a jewel theft in October. - France stated its ministers will not meet with the U.S. ambassador until the ambassador responds to a summons. - The International Criminal Court opens hearings into former President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines.
JTF News: Two sources. No adjectives. Just facts.

item.title: JTF News - February 25, 2026
item.content:encoded:
11 verified facts for February 25, 2026.
- Floods and landslides in Brazil resulted in at least 20 deaths. - Ukraine marks four years of war with Russia. - President Trump is scheduled to deliver a State of the Union address. - President Trump delivers State of the Union address. - Australia police make arrests in connection with the death of a grandfather who was mistakenly kidnapped. - Chancellor Friedrich Merz of Germany travels to Beijing. - Trial begins for Brazil politicians accused of ordering lawmakers' murders. - Japan announced plans to deploy missiles on an island near Taiwan by 2031. - Brazil politicians convicted for ordering murder of Rio activist councillor. - Cuban coast guard personnel killed 4 people in a US-flagged speedboat. - Ukrainian officials will meet with envoys representing President Trump in Geneva for talks.
JTF News: Two sources. No adjectives. Just facts.

item.title: JTF News - February 28, 2026
item.content:encoded:
13 verified facts for February 28, 2026.
- At least 55 Ghanaians have been killed in the Russia-Ukraine war, according to a Ghanaian minister. - Sweden reported that a Russian drone flew near a French aircraft carrier. - former President Bill Clinton stated to lawmakers that he 'did nothing wrong' regarding Jeffrey Epstein. - A tram derailed in Milan, resulting in two deaths and dozens of injuries. - President Trump suggested the U.S. could have a 'friendly takeover of Cuba'. - President Trump announced a ban on U.S. government use of Anthropic. - At least 11 people died after a military plane carrying banknotes crashed in Bolivia. - Israel announced it conducted a military strike against Iran. - Israel declared a state of emergency and stated it launched a strike against Iran. - Paramount is set for a $111 billion acquisition by Warner Bros. after Netflix withdrew its bid. - President Trump stated the US began 'major combat operations' against Iran. - Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystya Freeland urged all Canadians in Iran to shelter in place as the U.S. and Israel launched attacks. - Iran states it has conducted strikes on a U.S. military base in Bahrain and launched strikes in the region.
JTF News: Two sources. No adjectives. Just facts.

item.title: JTF News - February 27, 2026
item.content:encoded:
6 verified facts for February 27, 2026.
- At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, according to a Ghanaian government minister. - Sweden states that a drone jammed near a French aircraft carrier was Russian. - former President Bill Clinton stated to lawmakers that he 'did nothing wrong' regarding Epstein. - A tram derailed in Milan, resulting in two deaths and dozens of injuries. - President Trump suggested the U.S. could have a 'friendly takeover of Cuba.' - Pakistan's Defense Minister stated that Pakistan is in open war with Afghanistan following recent strikes.
JTF News: Two sources. No adjectives. Just facts.
